content:
There are quite a few resource proposals that still show as draft on the wiki that reflect resources in the current spec:
Have gone through ballot: Consent, DeviceUseStatement, PractitionerRole, RequestGroup, ServiceDefinition

Not balloted: AdverseEvent, Study (ResearchStudy)
, StudyParticipation (ResearchSubject), MessageDefinition, GraphDefinition, TestReport
For the non-balloted ones, we need to at least confirm if we're comfortable having them in the spec as draft. For the balloted ones, we need to decide if we want them to be constrained to FMM 0

We also have a number of "complex data types" that haven't formally been endorsed by FMG - or at least that I don't see a record of: ContactDetail
Contributor
DataRequirement
Dosage
ExtensionDefinition
ParameterDefinition
RelatedArtifact
TriggerDefinition
UsageContext
Where on the wiki is PractitionerRole draft? I thought I'd been through all the correct actions for that.
You may have been - it's possible the wiki isn't up-to-date. Link is here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Category:Pending_FHIR_Resource_Proposal
Thanks, it was approved on the last (or one before) FMG call.

If you can find it in the minutes, feel free to update the status of that one (and any others covered by the same call). I actually thought a few of the others had been approved too, but I'm not sure.

The "Consent" one you find is "Consent Tracker". We have "Consent" already approved. It is not categorized correctly, as it is right now categorized as a profile. But we approved it as a Resource. It just started life as a profile.
PractionerRole was approved contingent upon WG approval; since we didn't have a date as of yet, I didn't mark it approved.
